However, there's a minimum attendance requirement and if you miss too many classes you will fail, so make sure to get a doctor's note if you do get sick. There is also a library course on citations.

reviews.author: BitCoinsNotCoin
reviews.title: Great course, great grading, highly recommend
reviews.comment_content:
Two parts.

Part 1: Engineering Ethics. Engineering Disaster Case Report + Presentation.

Part 2: Creative Design. Creative Design Report + Presentation.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very Interactive. A lot of opportunities to practice public speaking. Sarah Carmichael is really good at hosting discussions. Every student in class got to share constructive opinions.
reviews.comment_grading: Very good grading, because the general level of English ability is higher.  Grading Based on Engineering Ethics Disaster Case Report, Presentation, Creative Design Report, Presentation, and Attendance(in class performance, punctuality, e.t.c).
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is manageable if time is managed correctly. No midterms, no finals. 4 mini assignments, 2 projects, 2 presentations.

reviews.author: Rabin
reviews.comment_content: mainly focusing on ethical issues regarding engineering aspects. The course has no exam and instead you will be graded upon projects done with your group and multiple essays submitted regarding different ethical issues and how to approach each of them.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was not too much as we would be given tasks every week to go home and re-visit so we can have further discussions in class. The topics would mainly be about technology or something that can be used by technology to enhance our lives, etc.

reviews.author: whateverrr
reviews.title: good grade course
reviews.comment_content: Since it is a language course for engineering students, the contents are more or less centered on engineering ethical issues and new innovations.
reviews.comment_teaching: Derek Wong is a humorous and serious lecturer, you will never get bored in his lecture. I really like the way he allowed us to express our ideas freely and interactively and listened to our opinions patiently during lecture. I really appreciate how he prepared to introduce the topics.
reviews.comment_grading: A very good grade course, most of the students can score within the range of A. The lecturer is lenient and not harsh on the grading. As long as you can fulfill the requirements given, you can score at least 5 or 6 out of 7 in the essay.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was not heavy when compared with other major courses. There are usually some tasks like writing a 150-word passage before the next lecture. Apart from that, as long as you are not a deadline fighter, you will never find this course is a demanding course. But if you are, you will only need to rush on your thousand-words essay before the deadline.

reviews.author: Anisha
reviews.comment_content:
The units are mostly about engineering ethics and project proposal on which you have to write one essay each. Then there are group presentations on those.
Personally, I thought both the parts were quite easy to do since most of the reading materials for the ethics cases were provided and the project essay did not have to be extremely technical and accurate.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor was extremely nice and welcomed a humorous approach to teaching. He created an interactive atmosphere in the class and encouraged everyone to participate and emphasized on the fact that it's not WHAT we think that he cares about but HOW we think it.
However, if I am being picky, I did not like how we had to present to our peers and then our peers would give us feedback. Honestly, that was not very helpful since our peers are just as skilled and experienced as we are and it should have been the professor giving us feedback.
reviews.comment_grading: Very good grading. The professor was extremely lenient and gave me all 7s and one 6 even though I thought my essays and presentations were average.
reviews.comment_workload: You gotta submit some canvas discussions every now and then and review your classmates' work as well. Other than that, the only workload comes before essay submission and preparing for the presentation.

reviews.author: Aaron W
reviews.comment_content: Just write two reports and do two presentations. You honestly don't learn much of anything, but it was super enjoyable nonetheless. You also have the chance to meet and get to know really cool people.
reviews.comment_teaching:
KK was super fun and chill, and I really enjoyed the class. He also gives really good advice about writing and presenting. One funny piece of advice he gave me was that my first presentation was good, but he could tell that we were just memorizing a script, so he told us not to write a script for the second one (just write down a few key points), so it'll sound more natural. I took his advice and basically winged the second presentation, which actually went pretty smoothly ahaha.
Unfortunately, he told us that he'd be leaving after the spring semester, which is a shame since he's honestly a great instructor and a really nice guy.
reviews.comment_grading:
Technical Report: 6.5 7 7 7
Presentation: 6 7 7

Innovation report and second presentation grades weren't released.

Overall: A+
reviews.comment_workload: The workload depends on how much effort you put in the course, but if you have good English, it isn't very difficult and it won't take up too much of your time.

reviews.author: Jricafort
reviews.comment_content: The content, which is about ethics and presenting creative ideas, is not the most interesting content in the world, but definitely useful and relevant to our professions. The content pertains to writing formally and presenting your ideas effectively.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dinesh is the most chill teacher in the history of the universe. His teaching style is insightful, going into depth about the content a lot more than most teachers, and I think that the insight is what makes his lessons more interesting than the majority of lecturers at UST.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair. Getting full marks is difficult, but not unreasonably so.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload, which consists of two essays and two presentations, is appropriate for a three-credit level course, and possibly even below-average.

reviews.author: donald0211
reviews.title: Generally OK
reviews.comment_content: The course has split into two sections, first one is about engineering ethics and the second one is about innovations. The first one is quite easy as you only need to complete projects and presentations based on the ethics given in the textbook. The second one is rather difficult because you have to think of an innovation that haven't been done before or is an improvement of an existing product.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is good, the atmosphere is quite relaxing you really don't feel like it's a normal lesson. The lesson is interactive and most of the time we are doing group works and sharing to others and receive comments from the other groups. Therefore from it you get to learn a lot.
reviews.comment_grading:
The course grading is based on two written assignments, two presentations and attendance scores. The second part which is innovation one weighted more than the first one a bit(only a few percent).
The grading is okay but I think it could be better. I got on average 6 overall and got a B+.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is less because for H class students do not need to take vocabulary test. Although sometimes there are assignments such as writing a summary on a video that is around 100 words which is quite easy. Other than that there are only two reports to write and two presentations need to prepare.

reviews.author: JhanNG
reviews.comment_content: Divided into two main parts: engineering ethics and innovative ideas. Tbh this course is very boring, but attendance is required so better attend the class. (not sure about the penalty of skipping class). Lecturer will make you talk in every class, so basically it's just a talking session twice a week.
reviews.comment_teaching: This instructor is rather strict, does not allow phones or chit chat in class. A good instructor overall, in my opinion.
reviews.comment_grading: For H classes we have no vocab test so the grading all depends on the projects. There are two projects in total, the first one is about engineering ethics and the second one is engineering idea. Pretty lame actually, but for good grade you have to put some effort into your projects, including written report and group presentation. Take note that H class students (abt 1.5k) have to write more words than mainstream class students (abt 1k).
reviews.comment_workload: All you have to do is write two reports in total. Very light workload overall. The instructor gives HW sometimes, but mostly easy one and does not counted in grading.

reviews.author: hskris
reviews.comment_content: The course was divided into two parts throughout the semester. First half is about Engineering ethics and the other half focuses on Engineering innovations. You will learn how to analyze ethics cases, write reports and technical papers, and present.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor teaches in a very engaging way. She always involves the students in class actively. She also doesn't mind when you have some questions or want to talk about something outside class.
reviews.comment_grading: If you get in the H-class then you should be already pretty good in English. Writing and speaking shouldn't be a problem for you. This course just tries to teach you how to do it in a technical style. There are 7 score levels for the assessment of presentation and writing, and H-class students did pretty good, like 5-7 score, which could get you around A range.
reviews.comment_workload: There are plenty of homework of writing essays on Canvas (like every week) but they are quite easy and doesn't take much time. And then there are two long technical writing tasks (1000+ words) for the midterm and final, with a group presentation afterwards (15 mins). It sounds difficult and lengthy, but really it doesn't take as long as you thought of once you start.

reviews.author: Kyu Won Shim
reviews.comment_content: This course is mainly composed of engineering ethics, technical description and innovative writing. For me, engineering ethics was relatively not interesting compared to other two parts of the course. Throughout the course, you will learn how to evaluate certain cases in the perspective of engineering ethics. Moreover, you will also learn how to correctly write technical description and innovative writing.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is experienced and encourages students to be engaged in the class. However, she does not notify homework through Canvas, which can be sometimes confusing for the students.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading for this course includes two essays and two presentations. Overall, if you get mixture of 6s and 7s for all assessments, 'A' range is assured. Lastly for the presentation, the instructor prefers students to memorize rather than depending on the script. Students should also actively contribute in the class to give good impression to the instructor.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload for this course is doable. Homeworks are easy to complete but just don't forget to do it. Morever, make sure to manage your time well for the two essays, since it will be very stressful to complete those essays overnight.

reviews.author: MEMENTO
reviews.comment_content: The content includes ethics in engineering filed and innovative technology. Basically you follow the textbook that you need to buy for this course, and the content is not too difficult.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor was very enthusiastic, and she always made us discuss with each other and present our ideas to the others. If I'd liked regular english class, I would have liked this course.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading scheme is very generous. If you get above 5.5 on average, I think you'll get at least A-, which is very good. I think the lowest you can get in this course is B+, unless anyone fails.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was more than moderate, because you need to do online discussions and write two essays in total, as well as having to prepare for 2 presentations, which is 15min per each group each. If you are prepared for writing essays and doing presentation from your highschool, then the workload would become very low.

reviews.author: ddd
reviews.comment_content:
Course is divided in 2 parts:
Engineers and social responsibility,
Engineers and creativity.

At the end of the first part you need to write an analytical report on some ethical issue (assigned to you by the prof) and prepare seminar presentation on the same topic.

At the end of the second part you need to write a proposal report on an invention of your choice (it must be something creative and innovative) and deliver a presentation about it.

Attendance requirement: after missing 3 classes - they send a warning letter to you and your department
after missing 6 classes - you fail
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher was okay, not very enthusiastic, but at least she is experienced and can give you a valuable feedback on the proposals and presentations.
reviews.comment_grading:
seminar presentation: 20%
analytical report: 25%
proposal presentation: 20%
proposal report: 30%
participation: 5%

I don't know about the rules, but after summing up the scores from all the assessments I got slightly above 90% and it was A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
5 online homeworks (very easy, ~200 words of writing)

sometimes you will be asked to watch or read something before the class

reviews.comment_content:
There are two main parts to this course, namely engineering ethical cases and introducing creative project.

We have to write analytical report and present it for the first part. For the second part of the course, we are required to write a proposal report on our creative project and present it.
reviews.comment_teaching: Overall, Ms. Joyce is a great instructor. She teaches very clearly. The class sessions are really relaxing and fun throughout the semester.
reviews.comment_grading:
OK.

Get 6666 (out of 7) in analytical report
6666 (out of 7) in ethics case presentation
6777 (out of 7) in proposal report
6666 (out of 7) in creative project presentation

Result: A
reviews.comment_workload:
Very OK (if you do not do things in last minute). There's not much to do in this course except writing two reports, submitting out-of-class assignments (usually writing short essays), presenting two of your reports. Also, there are no vocabulary tests.

*attendances required

reviews.author: coco1997
reviews.title: good course
reviews.comment_content: Very similar to TOK  in IB, much easier though. Just listen in class and you'll be fine. You have to talk in class so the teacher loves you.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is very good. She always jokes around with us and doesn't care if we go on our phones
reviews.comment_grading: Very good grading. If you get all 6s I think you'll get an A. Good chance to pull up your GPA or think about other courses.
reviews.comment_workload: Very little workload, got carried by Pishun Homworks every week or so which is not graded, but counts towards participation marks.

reviews.author: prashcr
reviews.title: Great course
reviews.comment_content: Learnt a lot about the different aspects of technical communication, focused on report writing, presentations, and use of language. As a DSE student, course was quite useful since we don't do many reports or presentations in secondary school.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite interactive, lots of group discussion/peer assessment in class. Class materials were highly varied, including short videos, news clippings, magazine and journal articles, in addition to textbook. Lecturer was very friendly.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is absolute. Easy A-range if you're proficient in English. Don't miss too many classes because professor's impression of you is quite important.
reviews.comment_workload: Very reasonable for engineering students. Weekly 100-200 word writing task, along with 4 vocab quizzes, 2 individual reports and 2 group presentations + reports over the semester.

reviews.author: SamK
reviews.comment_content:
The course itself is easy.
However, I didn't enjoy the course cause our instructor was not qualified to teach.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The instructor was so bad.
He was irresponsible, lazy and not qualified for teaching this course.
Our group had some trouble while doing our project, he stepped in and flipped a coin.
reviews.comment_grading:
grading was awful.
Even though I wrote fine piece of writing, I only able to get 5.5 for the assignments.
reviews.comment_workload:
there is not much.
one report and presentation for ethics,
one report and presentation for innovation.
ethic report is 1000~1500
innovation report is 1400~1600
both presentation is about 15min per group
